meanings.definition: Of or relating to a postulation.
meanings.sent1: The postulational theory was discussed in class.
meanings.sent2: Her postulational approach to problem-solving was effective.
meanings.sent3: The postulational idea seemed far-fetched at first.
meanings.sent4: His postulational reasoning led to a breakthrough.
meanings.sent5: The postulational concept opened up new possibilities.

meanings.sent1: The postulational assumptions were carefully considered.
meanings.sent2: Their postulational framework guided the research.
meanings.sent3: The postulational principles were put to the test.
meanings.sent4: She presented a postulational argument that was convincing.
meanings.sent5: The postulational basis of the theory was solid.

meanings.sent1: The postulational nature of the hypothesis was evident.
meanings.sent2: His postulational reasoning often led to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent3: The postulational approach sparked interesting discussions.
meanings.sent4: Their postulational mindset was key to their success.
meanings.sent5: The postulational aspect added depth to the analysis.
